message.body: /me thinks since @ks@zv mentioned "good", he probably knows also "bad" ones already ?
hm, I see
timeto put it as ringtone on your mobile, to fight this phobia
see you same place with even more fun, tomorrow
@zarka@zid merci. it is updated. Also, I moved 4 proxies to the offline-section. They are not working since 12 days
18-rotor multicopter "safer than a traditional helicopter", "currently fly for only 25 minutes and is expected to cost Â£200,000 when it goes on sale" http://www.bbc.com/news/technology-35987842
Hi @reg@zid :-)
th epeer numbers vary, depending on where you look
@reg@zid that is spam protection, one is allowed to post only every 10 mins or so
@reg@zid isn't it great that you have no limit here ? ;-)
that is for every ZeroNet app since April: http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroblog.bit/?Post:58:queueing+content+(in+ZeroNet+0.3.6+rev1098)
normally yes. BUt you can also specify some as "optional files", those would not be downloaded immediately
"avoid putting large unused files" <- yes. e.g. take me as example. Large sites I don't even go to.
@reg@zid "how do you know the website size before visiting?" you can't basically know, but I let regularly run size checks, and remove then big dirs
because e.g. someone could start with a small site and then upload more and more files to it, where e.g. my consent to such files is not OK, or they are NOT legal in my country
@reg@zid: about size: the hidden menu (when you move the 0 on the top right to left) has a setting: size limit, standard is 10 MB
+1 "it really rocks"
/me raises his 2nd coffee cup to the dear audience...
